item.title: Covid-19: Record-breaking day with 844,285 vaccine doses given in UK
item.description: Boris Johnson thanks "everyone involved" and calls on people to get the vaccine when they are invited.

item.title: Covid: Masks and social distancing 'could last years'
item.description: Measures may remain until jabs roll out across the world, Public Health England's Dr Mary Ramsay says.

item.title: Bristol protest: Demonstrators clash with police
item.description: Thousands took to the streets to protest against the Police and Crime Bill - despite warnings not to.

item.title: Foreign holidays: Minister refuses to rule out Covid ban extension
item.description: Defence Secretary Ben Wallace warns that booking a trip abroad would be "premature".

item.title: Diversity review under way at Buckingham Palace
item.description: The review is looking at improving progress towards greater diversity across royal households.

item.title: Covid-19: Miami imposes emergency curfew over spring break 'chaos'
item.description: Large crowds on the US city's party strips prompted an emergency overnight curfew.

item.title: Australia floods: Thousands to be evacuated as downpours worsen
item.description: New South Wales state is braced for heavy downpours amid the region's worst flooding in decades.

item.title: Afghanistan: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin on unannounced Kabul visit
item.description: The trip comes at a crucial time for the peace plan, just weeks before a troop pullout deadline.

item.title: Wingate arson: Ex-marine Sean Ivey 'overwhelmed' by generosity
item.description: A campaign raises over £190,000 for the family after a suspected arson attack destroyed their home.

item.title: Shortage of bouncers could stop clubs reopening
item.description: The body representing security staff says it may not be able to meet demand when nightlife restarts.

item.title: Old Firm fans praised for heeding 'stay at home' call
item.description: No arrests were made in following Sunday's Old Firm match and police thanked fans for respecting lockdown restrictions.

item.title: West Ham United 3-3 Arsenal: Gunners rescue point from 3-0 down
item.description: Arsenal come from three goals down to rescue a point in a stunning game at London rivals West Ham in the Premier League.

item.title: Leicester City 3-1 Man Utd: Foxes into FA Cup semi-finals
item.description: Leicester City move into the FA Cup semi-finals for the first time since 1981-82 as they eliminate Manchester United at the King Power Stadium.

item.title: 'We've changed the narrative': Pandemic positivity on the Alton Estate
item.description: The mental, physical and financial impact of lockdown on one of the UK's biggest council estates.

item.title: Goalkeeper scores injury-time equaliser in La Liga
item.description: Watch highlights as goalkeeper Yassine Bounou scores a 94th-minute equaliser to rescue a point for Sevilla against Real Valladolid in La Liga.

item.title: Nowruz: Millions celebrate Persian New Year around the world
item.description: From celebrations in Covid wards to fireworks displays, Nowruz has looked very different this year.

item.title: 'Sonic boom' in Dorset blamed on 'fireball meteor'
item.description: People in parts of south-west England report seeing a "streak of light" hurtling across the sky.

item.title: Netherlands experiments with Covid music festival
item.description: A music festival takes place as an experiment in the Netherlands, despite the rest of the country being under lockdown.

item.title: Covid: Welsh firms looking at flexi-working 'permanently'
item.description: Experts say many major organisations will have smaller offices and allow more flexible working.

item.title: Dawn Bilbrough: Food plea nurse considers quitting after Covid
item.description: Dawn Bilbrough's tearful plea for people to stop panic buying went viral during the first wave.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I isolated with mum for her last 14 days'
item.description: A daughter's story of how she moved into a Marie Curie hospice with her mother during the pandemic.

item.title: The dogs helping endangered Tasmanian devils find a mate
item.description: A world-first trial in Australia is using dogs to help the endangered species procreate.

item.title: Coronavirus: The Indian factory making 6,000 syringes a minute
item.description: One of the world's biggest syringe makers has ramped up production to meet the Covid demand.

item.title: Birmingham's Jewellery Quarter clock 'restored to former glory'
item.description: The chimes of the 118-year-old Jewellery Quarter clock are to ring out for the first time in 30 years.

item.title: Learning Welsh in lockdown... around the world
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has sparked a rise in people wanting to learn a new language.

item.title: Coronavirus: Dying nurse told sister 'follow in my footsteps'
item.description: Areema Nasreen was one of the youngest NHS workers to die of Covid-19 at the start of the pandemic.

item.title: Egyptian feminist Nawal El Saadawi dies at 89
item.description: Nawal El Saadawi, who has died at 89, drew outrage and admiration in her conservative home country.

item.title: North Korea’s ‘only openly gay defector’ finds love
item.description: Jang Yeong-jin fled North Korea to escape a loveless marriage. Now he is engaged to his boyfriend.

item.title: How many violent attacks and sexual assaults on women are there?
item.description: The disappearance of Sarah Everard has led to a conversation about the violence faced by women.

item.title: When is the census and what is it for?
item.description: The once-a-decade survey gives a snapshot of UK life and helps find out what services are needed.

item.title: Sir Keir Starmer: His first year as Labour leader
item.description: Supporters and critics assess Sir Keir's leadership, against a backdrop of the Covid crisis and party wrangles.

item.title: The website helping to sell homes with a bloody past
item.description: How homes formerly owned by fighters in Colombia's armed conflict are auctioned to benefit victims.

item.title: Mozambique conflict: Why are US forces there?
item.description: Islamic militants operating in the north have been the cause of growing concern in the region.

item.title: Myanmar coup: Tales from the streets of sacrifice and fear
item.description: Thousands are making difficult choices to protest against military rule. What are their stories?

item.title: Covid vaccines: Why some Americans are choosy about their jab
item.description: There are three options in the US, and some are turning their nose up at one of them.

item.title: Rachael Blackmore's 'phenomenal' Cheltenham week
item.description: Rachael Blackmore says her Cheltenham Festival was "phenomenal" after becoming the first woman to be the leading jockey at the meeting.

item.title: The forgotten referendum of 2011
item.description: Why the referendum everyone's forgotten shaped the last decade of our lives.

item.title: Chelsea to face Man City in FA Cup semi-final
item.description: Eight-time winners Chelsea will play quadruple-chasing Manchester City while Southampton face Leicester in the FA Cup semi-finals.

item.title: Morelos scores first Old Firm goal as unbeaten Rangers draw at Celtic
item.description: Alfredo Morelos' first goal in 13 Old Firm derbies ensures Rangers remain on course for an unbeaten Scottish Premiership season after draw at Celtic.

item.title: England lock Itoje defends 'truly special' head coach Jones after dire Six Nations
item.description: England lock Maro Itoje says head coach Eddie Jones is "truly special", insisting the players must be held accountable for their poor Six Nations.

item.title: Covid-19: Have a million people left the UK?
item.description: How far has the UK's foreign-born population fallen during the coronavirus pandemic?

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: What is the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine?
item.description: The Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccines should save many lives, say experts.

item.title: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Wales and Scotland have announced the easing of restrictions on people meeting

item.title: Coronavirus: When will pubs, hairdressers and gyms open?
item.description: Lockdown is being eased, so when will places like hairdressers, pubs and gyms open?

item.title: Covid: How are European countries tackling the pandemic?
item.description: Are European countries relaxing restrictions put in place to control a new wave of infections?

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: People aged 50 and over are the latest group to be invited to book their Covid vaccine.

item.title: Coronavirus: Where does the government borrow billions from?
item.description: How does it work when a government wants to borrow money, and when does it have to pay it back?

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 26 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Covid: What’s the problem with the EU vaccine rollout?
item.description: The coronavirus vaccine is being rolled out across the EU but there have been delays.

item.title: Coronavirus: What is the R number and how is it calculated?
item.description: The R number is a simple but crucial figure at the heart of lockdown decisions across the UK.

item.title: Coronavirus: Who should be shielding and why?
item.description: Shielding in England will end on 31 March.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: Covid-19: EU warns UK over vaccine exports
item.description: The EU threatens to block vaccine exports to the UK unless it "gets its fair share".

item.title: Coronavirus: How are the rules for weddings changing across the UK?
item.description: Wedding ceremonies are still restricted across the UK, but there are plans to ease the rules.

item.title: Covid: When can I go on holiday abroad or in the UK?
item.description: The government says it may still be too early to book summer holidays abroad.

item.title: EU plans for a 'vaccine passport' to allow travel
item.description: 'Vaccine passport' plans have been proposed by the EU, in order to make travel easier this summer.

item.title: Covid: When will children return to school and what are the rules?
item.description: Children are returning to school across the UK, after months of enforced home-schooling.

item.title: Lockdown Learning: What educational resources are on TV, iPlayer and online?
item.description: As most pupils return to school, the BBC will continue to offer a wealth of educational material.

item.title: Coronavirus: Data by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: What are the care home rules in England?
item.description: New guidance gives hope to relatives wanting to visit care homes.

item.title: What are the new rules for testing and hotel quarantine?
item.description: Travellers going to and from the UK face a growing number of restrictions.

item.title: Am I eligible for the new furlough scheme?
item.description: Furlough has been extended until the end of September.

item.title: Phone scammers: 'Give me £1,000 to stop calling you'
item.description: The rise of scam calls seems relentless - but can anything be done about them?

item.title: So you want a career in building computer games?
item.description: A career in computer games can be rewarding but tough to get into.

item.title: Bedfordshire: Army officer restores WW2 'secret garden' at Chicksands Priory
item.description: The garden at Chicksands Priory was used by code-breakers in World War Two but had been neglected.

item.title: Jed Mercurio: Line of Duty 'still in post-production'
item.description: Line of Duty writer Jed Mercurio says the new series is still not ready, despite airing on Sunday.

item.title: Covid: Lack of contraception sees goats boom in Llandudno
item.description: The Great Orme's goats have not been given their usual contraceptive injection due to the pandemic.

item.title: Covid: The inside story of the government's battle against the virus
item.description: Twenty of Downing Street's most senior politicians, officials and former officials take you "into the room" where essential Covid decisions were being made.
